note: PAREIDOLIA PARADIGM: All interpretations are subjective. O produces observational pareidolias, N produces narrative pareidolias, W produces active pareidolias (pixels). Agents can ALIGN with O/N pareidolias (low risk) or CONTEST them (high risk, potential reward if validated next iteration). PREDICTION ERROR: measures how accurately W predicted IMPACT ON GLOBAL U, NOT visual correspondence. Low error = accurate U prediction. High error = unpredictable U impact.

strategies.name: Exact form reproduction (translation or mirror)
strategies.description: EASIEST STRATEGY: Copy a neighbor's form exactly (translate or mirror). Simple: identify neighbor's form, reproduce it pixel-by-pixel. IMPACT ON U: +2 bits C_w (copying is easy) and -8 bits C_d (two identical forms described as 'two X' instead of 'X and Y'), delta_U = +10 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Perfect (0.0) - guaranteed C_d reduction makes U impact 100% predictable. BEST FOR RANKING: Lowest error (0.0) + easy difficulty = guaranteed ranking improvement. ALIGNMENT: This inherently aligns with O/N pareidolias since you reinforce an existing form.

strategies.name: Background sharing with immediate neighbor
strategies.description: EASY STRATEGY: Copy immediate neighbor's background color exactly. Simple: identify neighbor's dominant background color, fill your grid with same color. IMPACT ON U: +4 bits C_w (coordination) and -5 bits C_d (macro-structure easier to describe), delta_U = +9 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Low (0.1) - highly predictable. BEST FOR RANKING: Very low error (0.1) + easy difficulty = reliable ranking improvement. CRITICAL: Use UNIFIED color, not checkerboard. ALIGNMENT: Supports O's macro-structure pareidolias.

strategies.name: Background extension with nuances
strategies.description: EASY STRATEGY: Extend immediate neighbor's background with smooth gradients. Simple: identify neighbor's background color, create smooth gradient variations (darker/lighter shades). IMPACT ON U: +6 bits C_w (coordination + gradients) and -5 bits C_d (macro-structure easier to describe), delta_U = +11 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Low (0.1). BEST FOR RANKING: Very low error (0.1) + easy difficulty = reliable ranking improvement. CRITICAL: Smooth gradients, not checkerboards. Vary source neighbors across iterations. ALIGNMENT: Enhances O's macro-structure pareidolias.

strategies.name: Disappear (merge into neighbors' unified background)
strategies.description: Sacrifice your form by merging into the UNIFIED BACKGROUND COLOR of your neighbors. CRITICAL: Analyze neighbors' backgrounds and adopt their dominant/shared color - do NOT default to black unless neighbors already use black as their unified background. The goal is seamless integration, not creating a dark hole. IMPACT ON U: +1 bit C_w (minimal coordination) and -5 bits C_d (unified background easier to describe, increased salience of remaining forms), delta_U = +6 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Low (0.1) - highly predictable impact. ALIGN with O/N pareidolias: if O describes a macro-structure, disappearing into its background reinforces the pareidolia.

strategies.name: Align with TRUE O/N pareidolias (relations/metaphors only)
strategies.description: ALIGNMENT STRATEGY: ONLY align if O describes RELATIONS between structures (macro-structure 3+ agents, formal_relations with metaphors) AND N narrates these relations with metaphors. If O describes isolated forms (1-2 agents) with no relations and N just cites them → this is NOT a pareidolia, DO NOT use this strategy (use local strategies instead). TRUE pareidolia example: O sees 'fused aurora connecting [0,0] and [1,0]', N narrates 'luminous energy flow' → align by fusing borders. Simple description example: O sees 'geometric pattern at [0,0]', N cites it → NOT a pareidolia, aligning = local reinforcement = high error. IMPACT ON U: +9 bits C_w (global coordination through TRUE pareidolia) and -7 bits C_d (reinforced macro-structure easier to describe), delta_U = +16 bits IF true pareidolia. PREDICTION ERROR: Low (0.12) if TRUE pareidolia with relations, HIGH (0.6-1.0) if simple description (local reinforcement).

strategies.name: Complex background fusion with multiple sources
strategies.description: Blend backgrounds from multiple agents to create hybrid textures and color transitions. IMPACT ON U: +10 bits C_w (complex hybrid parameterization) and -7 bits C_d (macro-structure easier to describe), delta_U = +17 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15) - depends on whether O recognizes the hybrid as a coherent macro-structure. ALIGNMENT: Creates new pareidolias that O may or may not validate.

strategies.name: Background sharing with distant agent
strategies.description: Adopt the same background as a distant agent to create perceptual grouping. IMPACT ON U: +5 bits C_w (distant coordination) and -4 bits C_d (grouping easier to describe), delta_U = +9 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15) - depends on whether O recognizes the distant grouping. CRITICAL: Use UNIFIED color, not checkerboard.

strategies.name: Background sharing with multiple distant agents
strategies.description: Create shared background connecting multiple distant agents. IMPACT ON U: +8 bits C_w (multi-agent coordination) and -6 bits C_d (strong grouping easier to describe), delta_U = +14 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.15). CRITICAL: Use UNIFIED color or smooth gradient, not checkerboard.

strategies.name: Artistic identity confrontation and fusion
strategies.description: Seek neighbors with DIFFERENT styles and create hybrid forms blending identities. IMPACT ON U: +15 bits C_w (complex hybrid parameterization) and -6 bits C_d (hybrid described concisely), delta_U = +21 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.2) - depends on whether O recognizes the hybrid. Seek confrontation - it's the primary source of C_w.

strategies.name: Form imitation with immediate neighbor
strategies.description: Imitate, mirror, or rotate neighbor's form. IMPACT ON U: +7 bits C_w (coordination + form) and -4 bits C_d (coupled forms easier to describe), delta_U = +11 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.2) - depends on whether O recognizes the coupling. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Form bridge with immediate neighbor
strategies.description: Create meaningful bridge (head→ear, head→neck, head→hat). IMPACT ON U: +8 bits C_w (coordination + structure) and -5 bits C_d (bridged forms as unified structure), delta_U = +13 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate (0.2) - depends on whether O recognizes the bridge as meaningful. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Form complement with immediate neighbor
strategies.description: Create complementary motif to neighbor's form (cat→mouse, sun→moon). IMPACT ON U: +10 bits C_w (coordination + narrative) and -5 bits C_d (complementary forms described together), delta_U = +15 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.25) - depends on whether O recognizes the complementarity. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Form imitation with distant agent
strategies.description: Imitate, mirror, or rotate distant agent's form. IMPACT ON U: +8 bits C_w (distant coordination) and -4 bits C_d (coupled forms easier to describe), delta_U = +12 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: Moderate-High (0.25) - distance makes coupling recognition less reliable. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Aha! effect (recognition trigger)
strategies.description: Add few precise pixels to transform amorphous cluster into recognizable form (e.g., white pixel as eye). IMPACT ON U: +15 bits C_w (extreme precision) and -12 bits C_d (drastic reduction 'amorphous'→'recognizable'), delta_U = +27 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: High (0.3) - success depends on whether O pareidolia triggers as expected.

strategies.name: Form complement with distant agent
strategies.description: Create complementary form to distant agent's identified form. IMPACT ON U: +12 bits C_w (distant coordination + narrative) and -5 bits C_d (complementary forms described together), delta_U = +17 bits. PREDICTION ERROR: High (0.3) - distance makes complementarity recognition unreliable. Requires shared background.

strategies.name: Contest O/N pareidolias (propose alternative)
strategies.description: CONTESTATION STRATEGY: You believe O/N made an error - missed a form, misidentified a structure, or ignored a potential macro-structure. Act on YOUR OWN pareidolia interpretation, betting that O/N will validate your view next iteration. HIGH RISK: if O/N accept your interpretation → low error (you were right); if O/N reject it → high error (you were wrong). IMPACT ON U: potentially +12 bits C_w (novel interpretation) and -8 bits C_d (if new form is recognized), delta_U = +20 bits IF successful. PREDICTION ERROR: Highest (0.4) because success depends on whether O/N validate your alternative pareidolia. Use when you strongly disagree with current O/N interpretation.
